questions.question: What is the Prototype Pattern?
questions.answer: The Prototype Pattern is a creational design pattern that allows us to make new objects by copying existing objects, known as prototypes. Instead of creating new objects, this pattern can clone existing instances to generate new instances with the same properties and behaviors.

questions.question: What is the Prototype Pattern?
options: A design pattern for creating new objects by copying existing ones
A pattern for designing software architectures
A method for managing prototype objects
A technique for optimizing object creation

questions.question: What are the advantages of the Prototype Pattern?
options: Efficient object creation, reducing subclassing, configuring objects
Flexible object creation, reducing complexity, maintaining object relationships
Object creation efficiency, flexible object creation, reduced complexity
Maintaining prototypes, potential for inefficient cloning, need for proper initialization

questions.question: The Prototype Pattern is a creational design pattern that allows us to make new objects by copying existing objects.
The Prototype Pattern reduces the overhead of creating objects from scratch.
Implementing the cloning logic for objects can be complex, particularly when dealing with deep copies or objects with circular references.
Prototype Pattern is a ______ design pattern that allows us to make new objects by copying existing objects.
The Prototype Design Pattern can improve performance and reduce the usage of ______ by reusing objects for creating new ones.
Explain the Prototype Pattern and its key components.
